intro: Elatostema inamoenum, commonly known as the velvetleaf stellaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, and its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar growth habits. Elatostema inamoenum is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
